intro: Galium sylvaticum var. juranum, commonly known as the Juranum bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium sylvaticum var. juranum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
